title: Mission Description
content: However, it's not just the guests who return to this beautiful dream... People discuss him without concern, for home is now no more than a deathtrap for this man returning to familiar lands.Though the place remains as it was, people have changed. Take great care as you investigate the situation.

text: Several weeks later, Golden Hour , Penacony

speaker: Nightingale FamilyMember
line: Creating chaos is also a means to maintaining social stability, if you ask me.

speaker: Bloodhound FamilyMember
line: If you have the time for mindless gossip, you're probably better off spending it on getting actual work done.

speaker: Nightingale Family Member
line: They say this is all part of "ongoing investigations," but is there even any point to doing this? The threat's long been neutralized. They're just putting on a show.

speaker: Nightingale Family Member
line: I mean, look at us, and this sudden surge in inter-Family cooperative efforts. It's nothing but a pretense for those outsiders, isn't it?

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Sounds like you've got insider intel. Now I'm curious...

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Are the stories going around true? Was the furor that broke out a while ago really a result of trouble within the Oak Family ?

speaker: Nightingale Family Member
line: Those are some difficult questions... Didn't I just say that creating chaos is also a means to maintaining social stability?

speaker: Nightingale Family Member
line: Who knows who's been fanning the flames, but there are a dozen rumors going around out there, each one more outlandish than the last.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Oh, I've heard those. Conspiracy theories about how the IPC had orchestrated everything and... What was it again? That the chaos was only quelled because of an accident? Ugh, it makes no sense. So, what's the lowdown?

speaker: Nightingale Family Member
line: The truth has probably been long buried under all the hearsay. All I can say for sure is that someone's taken the rap for it.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: You mean... the former Oak Family head ?

speaker: Nightingale Family Member
line: Bingo! Most of the blame was pinned on him when the Charmony Festival was abruptly canceled. Since then, not a single soul's seen him.

speaker: Nightingale Family Member
line: Heck, forget his whereabouts — nobody even knows if he's still alive! Talk about scary. For all we know, we might have watched something go down in history — like what happened to the Blackplum Family back then — without even realizing it.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: I've heard another theory about that family head, though...

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: I beg your pardon, sirs. Dreamweavers are carrying out inspections on the routes around here, and all affected facilities have been closed off. Kindly take a detour in the meantime.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What happened? Is this because of the Stellaron ? Geez, are we Penaconians never gonna dream in peace again?

speaker: Nightingale Family Member
line: There is no cause for alarm, sir. The Stellaron has already been sealed. This is just a routine inspection. A move to heighten security, if you will.

speaker: Nightingale Family Member
line: Please rest assured that The Family will do everything in our power to protect the sweet dreams of every guest.

speaker: Weary Passerby
line: I see. We'll leave the two of you to your work, then.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: ...Hmm?

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Excuse me, sir...

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Have we met before?

text: (The power of Harmony distorts the screen)

speaker: Weary Passerby
line: Do you recall when or where we might've met?

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: My bad, I must be mistaken. Sorry about that. Sweet dreams to both of you, sirs.

speaker: Wonweek
line: You sure have a knack for stirring up trouble. Of all the routes available, you had to take the one that Bloodhound's keeping watch over.

speaker: Sunday
line: We shouldn't run into any problems with you around. Even if they see through the Harmony 's power of disguise, there'll be a way for us to escape.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Spare a thought for me, will you? Just being in your company is plenty enough to get me into trouble, Mr. Prime Fugitive of Penacony.

speaker: Sunday
line: And that is exactly why I need you with me. You're the only one I can rely on in Penacony now.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Hmph, the only one you can rely on, huh.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What about her?

speaker: Sunday
line: At least she was spared from the consequences of my actions.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What a shame, huh?

speaker: Sunday
line: Why do you say that?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Just thought that being mean might be more effective than consoling you.

speaker: Wonweek
line: I've seen plenty like you. Eager for everyone to take you to task after a setback because that's the only way you'll feel better. As though the more they condemn you, the more likely you can rectify your mistake.

speaker: Wonweek
line: That said, if I'd really wanted to hit you where it hurts, I'd use a different approach... Like a show of sympathy, for example.

speaker: Sunday
line: You're right. I won't deny that.

speaker: Wonweek
line: She should still be in Penacony. Aren't you going to look for her?

speaker: Sunday
line: That won't be necessary. I'm sure you already know why, considering your vested interest in reading my thoughts.

speaker: Sunday
line: ...I can't bring myself to see her when I'm a fugitive.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Alright, then let's keep going. Helping a fugitive return to their home... So exciting.

speaker: Sunday
line: I see two Bloodhounds... They appear to be on official business, unlike the pair from earlier.

speaker: Sunday
line: What's happening at Aideen Park?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Hey! Heeeey! In case you didn't notice, I can't see anything!

speaker: Sunday
line: My apologies. I forgot that you're not very tall.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Remind me... Why do I have to make this trip with you again?

speaker: Sunday
line: We've been through this. You're the only one I can turn to now.

speaker: Sunday
line: Besides, we once lived a cat-and-dog existence. Embroiling you in my affairs won't weigh on my conscience.

speaker: Wonweek
line: You certainly don't have much of one if you can bring yourself to say something like that.

speaker: Sunday
line: Yet you will repay this favor all the same. After all, you're only alive today because of me. You owe me that much.

speaker: Wonweek
line: ...Holy moly! Can you get any more conceited?

speaker: Sunday
line: When you were abandoned in the wild and near your end, I showed you a way to survive and helped you escape the jaws of death.

speaker: Sunday
line: When you were at your wits' end and felt lost about your future, I did everything within my power to help you safeguard your position in The Family.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Okay, okay. I get it already. You have a way with words, I'll give you that. Still, it's one thing to repay a favor, but quite another to knowingly put myself in harm's way.

speaker: Wonweek
line: I don't understand. Why are you hell-bent on going back to Penacony? Is this an IPC mission?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Did they make you a deal? "You can have your freedom back, but in return, you must turn against all whom you once called family" or something like that?

speaker: Sunday
line: Regrettably, Lady Bonajade didn't drop so much as a hint about it.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Stranger in a Strange Land 3.mp4

speaker: Jade
line: Go now. You are free — O chosen one, who dared to exceed his bounds. Sever your wings, descend to the mortal realm, and walk their lands. See what this world is truly like.

speaker: Sunday
line: I will not accept your charity.

speaker: Jade
line: As I mentioned earlier: It's a trade, and you don't have to give me an answer right now. Rewards are not reaped in a day, and if there's one thing I'm best at, it's waiting. The sweet dream still continues, and the night is still long — you have plenty of time to contemplate your answer.

speaker: Sunday
line: She only left me with a most intriguing message before setting me free. As for whether I can afford the price of my freedom...

speaker: Sunday
line: I'll only know when I find out what it is.

speaker: Wonweek
line: But nothing good ever comes out of being in the IPC's debt.

speaker: Sunday
line: I'll cross that bridge when I get to it. For now, there's still some time before that payment is due, so why not exercise the right to freedom that I've just regained?

speaker: Wonweek
line: By walking straight into a trap?

speaker: Sunday
line: Or by making amends for past deeds.

speaker: Sunday
line: When it's time to go, this will be farewell for good. So, before I leave Penacony, I'd like to take some time to look back on all the events that have taken place.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Can't you just look back on it from a distance?

speaker: Sunday
line: There's something else I want to do, too. The Embryo of Philosophy may have fallen, but the Order in Penacony wasn't built in a day. This sweet dream is likely to still contain residual traces of the Oak Family's influence.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Get off your high horse. The other four Families are more than capable of working things out on their own.

speaker: Sunday
line: I might have gone astray, but others shouldn't have to clean up after my mistakes.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Then you should also know that the IPC isn't going to help you a second time. If you fall into The Family's hands again, you're done for.

speaker: Sunday
line: You know how it is — old habits die hard.

speaker: Sunday
line: The tie should be on the center line, the shirt must not protrude from the vest, trouser creases should be perfectly straight, and always aligned with the tips of your shoes.... We should always ensure that everything is in order before walking out the door.

speaker: Sunday
line: The same applies when bidding my home farewell, too.

title: Step Description
content: Sunday has lost his wings and fallen into the state you now see. He has come to realize that miracles are not to be carried out in the skies but on the ground. And, at the beginning of this precious freedom he had found, he hopes to make his farewells quick and orderly.Bid farewell to this beautiful dream with the help of Wonweek. Make as many unreasonable requests as you need, and you can just owe him a favor for later.

speaker: Wonweek
line: But what has Aideen Park got to do with you? Don't tell me that the founder's one of your disguises?

speaker: Sunday
line: I'm not that old.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Oh, come on. Take a joke, will you?

speaker: Tired Bloodhound Family Member
line: Sorry, but park facilities are out of order. Refurbishment works are currently underway. Please come back again later.

speaker: Sunday
line: That sounds familiar.

text: (The power of Harmony distorts the screen)

speaker: Wonweek
line: Ahem. I'm aware of the situation. You can skip the report.

speaker: Tired Bloodhound Family Member
line: Huh? What are you talking about? I—

speaker: Tired Bloodhound Family Member
line: ...Mr. Wonweek? Please excuse me. I should've recognized you earlier. I must be more tired than I realized.

speaker: Wonweek
line: I wanna know what's going on in there. You'll tell me, won't you?

speaker: Tired Bloodhound Family Member
line: There's nothing much to say, actually. We Bloodhounds are just as baffled as you are. My guess is that it's simply part of the aftermath of the Stellaron incident.

speaker: Sunday
line: Aftermath?

speaker: Tired Bloodhound Family Member
line: You are...?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Renowned workaholic, Mr. Workday. He works for me. You don't know him?

speaker: Tired Bloodhound Family Member
line: Ah, I see. Pardon my ignorance, sir.

speaker: Tired Bloodhound Family Member
line: Coming back to the topic of the park... Let's just say that it has been recently observed that certain behaviors are not tolerated around here.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What happens if you violate the prohibitions?

speaker: Tired Bloodhound Family Member
line: It's baffling, but corrective measures will be taken. It's kind of difficult to explain... Maybe you'd like to see for yourself?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Yeah, that works. Can you keep watch over the entrance? We'll go in and have a look for ourselves.

speaker: Tired Bloodhound Family Member
line: Please take these notes with you. They may come in handy.

speaker: Sunday
line: You shouldn't have said that just now. It'll only make us look suspicious.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Said what?

speaker: Sunday
line: "Mr. Workday."

speaker: Wonweek
line: Hmph, I was just telling the truth. I've always found this name to be more suitable for you.

speaker: Wonweek
line: So, why are we here? You managed this park before?

speaker: Sunday
line: You could say that. I was still a child back then. To become the Bronze Melodia of the Oak Family, I'd gone under Mr. Gopher Wood 's tutelage.

speaker: Sunday
line: We were taking a walk in the park like any other day when he suddenly hit on the idea to have me manage the park. Within the domain he demarcated, my every word would hold the force of law.

speaker: Sunday
line: In hindsight, that was probably the first time that I enforced Order.

speaker: Wonweek
line: You rose through the ranks soon after. I take it that you must have done a pretty good job?

speaker: Sunday
line: Quite the contrary — I made a terrible mess of things. Fortunately, the tourists thought of it as nothing more than a spell of merrymaking.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Was that his way of training you?

speaker: Sunday
line: Perhaps he was just using an approach with lighter consequences to show me what he'd learned in life: That there is never an ideal paradigm when it comes to rules. If the enforcer is incapable of introspection, then even regulations once laid down with the noblest of intentions will eventually become defiled.

speaker: Sunday
line: This place is no exception. The distorted Afterechoes of the Order... will only add to the chaos.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Let's see what we have on these notes...

children.text: I'll write down what I've noticed for now. I'll go over things when I meet the others later.
— No consumption of food other than burgers, especially ice cream.
— Only cast and crew members are allowed on the stage.
— Do not discard trash in trashcans.
— Please do not use SoulGlad bottle caps sold by the Dreamjolt Troupe while experiencing the attractions.
— Handstand walks around flowerbeds are prohibited.
Attention: Conducts that have not been mentioned are not necessarily safe. They just have not yet been reviewed.

text: Based on the rules, investigate the unusual occurrence

title: Step Description
content: No farewell ever goes smoothly... According to the Bloodhound Family members, something unusual has occurred here. What's more, it is likely connected to some kind of distorted Afterechoes...Let's have Wonweek pull some strings and head to Aideen Park to investigate.

speaker: Wonweek
line: "No consumption of food except for burgers." ...What?

speaker: Wonweek
line: "Handstand walks around flowerbeds are prohibited."

speaker: Wonweek
line: Let's not worry about how the Bloodhounds figured this one out. Hm, I reckon the worst that can happen for this one is that they'll flip you back onto your feet. Say, why don't you test it out this time? I'd love to see you do a handstand!

speaker: Sunday
line: No, thank you.

speaker: Wonweek
line: "Be kind to birds."

speaker: Sunday
line: Looks like some rules weren't distorted. That's a word-for-word account of what I said back then.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Did you make this rule because your sister is named Robin ?

speaker: Sunday
line: No, it was for Mr. Gopher Wood. He used to stop by the park to people-watch and appreciate the vibrancy of life. This was his way of recharging whenever things wore him out.

speaker: Sunday
line: I wanted him to rest undisturbed.

speaker: Wonweek
line: "No consumption of food other than burgers, especially ice cream." ...Please tell me you didn't make this rule.

speaker: Sunday
line: I have nothing against desserts. The only reason I made that rule is so that people can learn to wait in line in an orderly manner for things instead of shoving and jostling people around.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What happens if I break the rule?

speaker: Sunday
line: It's as the Bloodhound said: Corrective measures will be enforced.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Hmph. Try me.

speaker: Sunday
line: Wait, don't—

text: In the blink of an eye, the ice cream vanished.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Pfft. So, where are those corrective measures?

speaker: Sunday
line: That's odd.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Didn't I tell you? The Family can take care of the issue without you having to get involved.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Next on the list is the stage. Let's go and check it out.

speaker: Wonweek
line: "Only cast and crew members are allowed on the stage." Hm, a surprisingly reasonable rule.

speaker: Sunday
line: And an easy one to test. Neither of us is part of the cast or a crew member. Let's try it out.

speaker: Wonweek
line: ...Huh?

speaker: Sunday
line: Let's try that again.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What's going on?

speaker: Sunday
line: "Guide those who have lost their way back onto the right path." Looks like this is an example of the "corrective measures" that the Bloodhound mentioned. It's exactly what I would've done back then.

speaker: Wonweek
line: You've been iron-fisted since you were little, haven't you?

speaker: Wonweek
line: ...Wait a sec. If this is how violations are corrected, then everything that I ate just now...

speaker: Sunday
line: I tried to warn you.

text: Like a drunkard commonly seen by the sidewalk, he vomited a sliver of rainbow—

speaker: Wonweek
line: Ugh...

speaker: Sunday
line: How do you feel?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Now, I'm feeling murderous...

speaker: Sunday
line: In any case, say what you will, but I can't sit by and do nothing. Not when I'm the cause of all this trouble in Aideen Park. There's no need to involve the Dreamweavers. I'll fix these distortions once and for all.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What's the plan?

speaker: Sunday
line: Nothing complicated. All distortions have their roots. We'll be able to trace them to the source once they manifest. Breaking a few rules will do. We just need to make sure that the corrective measures that will be implemented aren't too much for us to handle.

speaker: Sunday
line: When a distorted Afterecho manifests to correct us, I'll be able to pinpoint its whereabouts.

speaker: Sunday
line: Then I'll use the power of tuning to heal the Dreamscape.

title: Step Description
content: This is very reminiscent of the real world... The Dreamscape is starting to make completely unreasonable requests of people.Try breaking some more rules to find the source of the Afterechoes.

speaker: Wonweek
line: So... Can I take it that rules are meant to be broken now?

speaker: Sunday
line: "Guide those who have lost their way back onto the right path." Looks like this is an example of the "corrective measures" that the Bloodhound mentioned. It's exactly what I would've done back then.

text: (Interact with the ice cream truck again, optional)

speaker: Wonweek
line: Uh, I say we pass on this. Thanks to you, I never want to eat ice cream again.

speaker: Wonweek
line: "Do not discard trash in trashcans."

speaker: Wonweek
line: This is absurd! Did you make this rule too?

speaker: Sunday
line: Children tend to be fascinated by such paradoxes. I was no exception.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Forget it, I don't even know how to joke about this. Well, what do you suggest we throw in?

children.speaker: Wonweek
children.line: What is this, a woodcutter's trashcan!?

text: I don't have anything we can use for now.

speaker: Wonweek
line: "Do not discard trash in trashcans." (Submit Pleasant-Looking Trash ×1 , first time only) You insert Pleasant-Looking Trash into the bin as a sign of consideration, and in the blink of an eye, more Pleasant-Looking Trashes emerge — what an inappropriate application of the Horn of Plenty concept. (Obtain Pleasant-Looking Trash ×3 ) (Submit Pleasant-Looking Trash ×1 , second time only) You insert more Pleasant-Looking Trash. The trashcan is overjoyed and silently pay its respects to you. Before you left, you suddenly feel a sense of dignity. (Obtain Sanctity of the Trashcan ×1 ) (The Trashcan disappears)

children.text: You attempt to insert some things, but no reaction is observed — This little trashcan has quite the personality, successfully grabbing your attention.

speaker: Wonweek
line: "Please do not use SoulGlad bottle caps sold by the Dreamjolt Troupe while experiencing the attractions."

speaker: Wonweek
line: The Dreamjolt Troupe? Where? Are they hiding or something?

speaker: Bubble Hound
line: Awoooo!

speaker: Wonweek
line: Oh, there it is! Found a good hiding spot, didn't ya? Come on, let's buy some bottle caps from it.

speaker: Sunday
line: Just one moment.

text: Sunday places some Alfalfa credits in front of Bubble Hound.

speaker: Bubble Hound
line: Arf, arf, arroooo!

speaker: Wonweek
line: Ahaha, let me translate that for you: "Who are you trying to pay with your spare change?"

text: Sunday has placed even more Alfalfa credits.

speaker: Sunday
line: I'm afraid you're going to have to handle this if it isn't enough.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Handle this? Handle what?

speaker: Wonweek
line: ...Wait, is that really all you've got on you!?

speaker: Sunday
line: May I remind you that I'm currently on the run?

speaker: Bubble Hound
line: Awoooo, awoooo!

text: The Dreamjolt Troupe lets out terse shouts. It moves closer, pointing the soda bottle hanging in front of it towards the two.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Whew, luck's on our side. Looks like we scraped together just enough.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Shall we give this capsule machine a try and see what happens?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Nothing's off so far. Maybe we should open the capsule?

children.text: Since warnings have proven futile, punishment is now inevitable.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Uh, they can't be seriously going that far, right?

speaker: Wonweek
line: No, no, no! Hey, look out!

children.text: Wave 1: Dreamjolt Troupe's Fortune Seller ×2, Dreamjolt Troupe's Bubble Hound ×2
Wave 2: Dreamjolt Troupe's Fortune Seller ×3, Dreamjolt Troupe's Winder Goon ×1, Dreamjolt Troupe's Bubble Hound ×1

speaker: Wonweek
line: Did they have to do that!? They could've just recalled the capsule!

speaker: Sunday
line: Perhaps making the attractions no longer just attractions is another corrective measure?

speaker: Wonweek
line: Ugh, aren't the rules being too finicky with words?

speaker: Sunday
line: We're not breaking enough rules. We should look elsewhere too.

speaker: Sunday
line: Enough. The location of the distortion is nearby.

text: The Afterechoes of Order, once distorted, only add to the chaos. As a tuner, Sunday can easily discern where the harmony of Dreamscapes has been disrupted. The Afterechoes of Order, once distorted, only add to the chaos. As a tuner, Sunday can easily discern where the harmony of Dreamscapes has been disrupted.

title: Step Description
content: This is very reminiscent of the real world... The Dreamscape is starting to make completely unreasonable requests of people.Tune the Dreamscape and eliminate the distorted Afterechoes of Aideen Park.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Oh, there it is. Huh, it does look somewhat like you.

speaker: Sunday
line: Time for it to disappear for good.

text: (The power of Harmony distorts the screen)

speaker: Sunday
line: "Reveal thyself unto me, as is customary — All creatures endowed with eyes bear souls of equal worth."

speaker: Wonweek
line: Whoa, it worked! The IPC totally should've sent someone to keep an eye on you. Aren't they worried that you might make a comeback in Penacony and grow a new pair of wings?

speaker: Sunday
line: So long as there remains a need for me to keep a low profile, I'm no threat to them.

speaker: Wonweek
line: That's true. Come to think of it, you had always been in the spotlight, be it as a respected member of the elite or a leader. When was the last time you fell into the mud? All the way back during your childhood days?

speaker: Sunday
line: Sometime before I turned six. Like most boys would, I tried to fly with my ear feathers, only to fall into a pit. I almost broke my halo.

speaker: Wonweek
line: That was sarcasm, in case you didn't realize. But whoa, you actually remember something like that?

speaker: Sunday
line: You never forget times of failure. It's only human nature.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Bah, you're probably the only one who'd consider something like that a failure.

title: Step Description
content: You've reflected on the past and eliminated the lurking danger. It's time to leave Aideen Park... Look back, then continue onwards. Perhaps these are the only two things a person can ever do in life.

speaker: Wonweek
line: What is it this time?

speaker: Sunday
line: Just looking back.

speaker: Wonweek
line: But nothing's there!

speaker: Sunday
line: That's the whole point of revisiting a place. When I look at everything here, the memories are so fresh it's as if it all only happened yesterday.

speaker: Sunday
line: When the younger me tasted failure here, I ran myself ragged to fix the mess. I'd thought myself no longer the same person as before... But it looks like I was just going round in circles.

speaker: Sunday
line: I'm glad for this chance to look back on my past in this way. Come now, we should go. This will be a long farewell.

speaker: Wonweek
line: So, where are we heading next?

speaker: Sunday
line: Oti Mall . There are Bloodhounds stationed along the way, though. It might be better to take a quieter route...

speaker: Welt
line: I don't mean to meddle, but I'd advise you to stay away from that place.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Did something happen?

speaker: Welt
line: There isn't any concrete information yet, but anomalies have been reported around the area. The Family is currently investigating.

speaker: Welt
line: ...You okay?

speaker: Sunday
line: I'm fine.

speaker: Sunday
line: The Stellaron incident may have been quelled, but who is to say that nobody has another agenda?

speaker: Sunday
line: Thanks for the tip, sir. We'll make a detour. May you stay safe, too.

speaker: Welt
line: Hold on.

speaker: Welt
line: Sweet dreams are technically safe, but it would be wise to look out for oncoming vehicles.

speaker: Sunday
line: Thank you.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Whew, that was no ordinary passerby. It's a miracle that he didn't see through your disguise.

speaker: Sunday
line: The Astral Express should've departed a long time ago. Why is he still in Penacony...?

speaker: Sunday
line: ...We needn't change our plans because of him, but be sure to keep your guard up.

speaker: Sunday
line: I hope nothing terrible has fallen upon Penacony while I was in captivity the last few days.

title: Step Description
content: Perhaps Welt has spent too much time travelling with people, and they are starting to forget how it feels to face him as a foe... It's truly terrifying to have Welt as your "enemy."Find a way to get away from him and continue your journey of reflection.

speaker: Sunday
line: Come now, it's time we set off. Let's not stick too close to each other, just in case. A few feet or so between us will do.

speaker: Sunday
line: Seems I let my wishful thinking get the best of me. Will you at least give me a chance to explain?

speaker: Welt
line: I will. But before I do...

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission The Departed Will Return First.mp4

speaker: Welt
line: Put your hands behind your back and answer my questions in short sentences.

speaker: Sunday
line: Short sentences?

speaker: Welt
line: I need to make sure your words aren't concealing any dangerous incantations.

speaker: Sunday
line: I can't believe I've left everyone with such a peculiar impression of me...

speaker: Sunday
line: Please believe me when I say that I didn't come back here with ill intent. Penacony will never experience the Order again either.

speaker: Welt
line: I'm afraid I won't be taking your words at face value. Not after how you wielded the power of Harmony.

speaker: Welt
line: Answer me. What are you doing here?

speaker: Sunday
line: It looks like there's only one way to gain your trust.

speaker: Sunday
line: Come on out, Wonweek. We've found ourselves an ally.

text: Sunday unreservedly shares his story with Welt...

speaker: Welt
line: So, it was the IPC that freed you?

speaker: Sunday
line: My sister has likely made an agreement of some sort with them. As for how I'm able to move around freely in Penacony, I have Wonweek to thank for that.

speaker: Sunday
line: As you can see, I've only returned to my home to bid it farewell. Would you be kind enough to give me a chance to say goodbye so that I may leave without regrets?

speaker: Welt
line: Agreed, but until you leave Penacony for good, you are to stay by my side.

speaker: Sunday
line: You have my gratitude.

speaker: Welt
line: ...I left my home in a hurry, too... I know how it feels.

speaker: Welt
line: That said, I can't make this call by myself. My companions need to know about this too.

speaker: Sunday
line: The Astral Express crew is in Penacony, too?

speaker: Welt
line: Come with me — we'll go find them. You come along too.

speaker: Wonweek
line: Okay, okay. Boy, this is gonna be a party!

text: Go with Welt to see his companions

title: Step Description
content: Unfortunately, there is no way to escape from Welt. Go with him to meet his Express companions and find a way to get some time to yourself.

speaker: Welt
line: We're here. They should be somewhere nearby.

speaker: Sunday
line: Mr. Yang. If you don't mind, there's something that puzzles me.

speaker: Sunday
line: Now that the crisis on the Planet of Festivities has been averted, shouldn't the Astral Express have departed to continue on its trailblazing journey? Why have you and your companions stayed behind in Penacony?

speaker: Sunday
line: Could it be that someone stirred up trouble after I left?

speaker: Welt
line: And if that were indeed the case?

speaker: Sunday
line: I doubt I'm in any position to be proposing ideas, but I'm happy to defer to the Nameless and aid with any plans you may have.

speaker: Welt
line: There's no need to worry, all is well in Penacony. Our reason for lingering here is a certain unusual passenger .

speaker: Sunday
line: A passenger?

speaker: Welt
line: The Express has been commissioned to send a passenger back home. We're just resting up in Penacony for a while before we depart.

speaker: Welt
line: Hm?

speaker: Sunday
line: By "passenger," do you mean this lady here?

speaker: Sunday
line: Or...

speaker: Sunday
line: ...These ladies?

speaker: Welt
line: This... How...

speaker: March 7th
line: You're finally here, Mr. Yang! We have a huge problem!

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
